2ONE

Artwork

A fierce Mouth - seductive Lips,
attributes to be rich.

Thunderous - inverse to her tone,
caught in a triangle of monochrome.

Standing in blue, labeled - but not true.
Naked below. a Human.


Vulnurable.

Series: Where do we go, where do we come from.

Print / Hahnemühle Fine Art Baryta / 60x90cm

  • Date: 04-20
  • Client: Private Project
  • Category: Artwork

Aster

Fashion

Your Aster is a brand dedicated to handcrafted leather bags made in Ethiopia. Rooted in Ethiopian heritage, the founder brings a deep personal connection to the country and its craftsmanship. At the heart of Your Aster lies a strong commitment to a fair and transparent supply chain, supporting skilled artisans and honoring traditional techniques while creating timeless, high-quality pieces.

www.youraster.com

  • Date: 11-22
  • Client: Aster
  • Category: Commercial Social

Burano

Experimental

Known for its exquisite lace craftsmanship and vibrant, colorful houses, Burano is a must-visit when traveling to Venice. After seeing the first magical façade, I felt inspired to create a minimalist series that captures the island’s unique charm.

  • Date: 06-22
  • Client: Private Project
  • Category: Minimalism Photography

Creed X

Documentary

At X Games Norway, I was on site to shoot a documentary about an upcoming athlete — a super challenging assignment due to the difficult shooting conditions inside the venue. During a break, I observed the Moto X riders pushing their limits even in training. As the light improved, I captured a moment where, on the third shot, Corey Creed sent his bike soaring high enough to nearly meet the rooftop.

  • Date: 08-19
  • Client: Private
  • Category: Documentary

Digital Distraction

Artwork

Half way sick, but still hooked.

Do you know the feeling when you can’t look away even if it is disturbing?
The digital revolution made it more or less secretly socially acceptable. Disturbing content is all over the internet and access is easy. A fast way to distribute is via social media. By now, approximately half the world’s population is connected and influenced by it. This has led to a never before seen potential to reach and connect an audience. Algorithms are used to filter content, based on user classification. Congruent communication boxes are made. This uniformity might be enchanting but it distraction of all. Still, outside of this box there is a real, unfiltered world with different opinions to handle.


What is real?

Series: Where do we go, where do we come from.

Print / Hahnemühle Fine Art Baryta / 50x75cm

  • Date: 03-20
  • Client: Private Project
  • Category: Artwork

Prejudice

Artwork

We learn - we judge.

Can you hear,
the voice inside?

It’s hard to catch?
Its drowned in teachings?

That’s trust been taken,
and prejudice awaken.

Series: Where do we go, where do we come from.
Print / Hahnemühle Fine Art Baryta / 50x75cm

  • Date: 03-21
  • Client: Private Project
  • Category: Artwork

Sequence

Sports

Mount Blaser near Serles offered challenging freeride conditions — little snow, icy terrain, and difficult light. Despite this, I chose to shoot a sequence, deliberately moving away from a traditional approach. The camera position was never fixed; instead, both subject and camera remained in motion, making the movement itself an integral part of the work. The layering was created using varying ratios and contrasts, emphasizing depth and clearly revealing the camera’s own movement within the landscape.

  • Date: 03-21
  • Client: Private Project
  • Category: Sports Photography

Super(ri)or

Artwork

When taking a close look how society treats our surroundings, it is quite interesting that humans seem to feel superior to nature itself. Imagine that we are just bubbles in an aquarium which try to reach the surface. Equipped with natural & limited abilities of the human body the glass will always be a barrier. On top there might be an idea of the outside, but there is a different world which does exist in a different aggregation state. This physical boundary is reflected in the inabitlity to receive and process the majority of what is permanetly around and limits are set. Natures unwritten law is balance, nothing is superior. Life can only exist if death is also present. Yet we are blind to honor that adaption and acceptance are the most crucial parts of symmetry. In contrast humans try to compete with nature and seek to control it. This elementary bias in thought could be based in short term thinking as a lifetime is nothing compared to existance itself. Might this be the reason why society does not confront itself that symmetry must be focused on every level?

I guess balance hurts, as we all are just shadows, which need the sun to shine…

Series: Where do we go, where do we come from.

  • Date: 05-21
  • Client: Private Project
  • Category: Artwork

Father & Son

Experimental

The image shows two trees of different sizes in front of a sunset: a small tree and a larger tree standing directly behind it. The larger tree represents a father’s guiding presence, standing behind the smaller tree not to shield it from the world, but to support and help it overcome challenges. The composition highlights encouragement, guidance, and the quiet strength that allows the child to grow confidently while knowing support is always present.

  • Date: 01-21
  • Client: Private Project
  • Category: Minimalistic Photography

About Me

Who I am and what I do

I’m passionate about creativity, design, and exploring new tools. My experience spans marketing planning, online campaign management, media production, and social media, with hands-on expertise in event management, overseeing POS marketing production from prototyping to execution, and coordinating international projects.

I enjoy experimenting and am constantly looking for ways to merge ideas, technology, and visual thinking into meaningful work.

Off the clock, I chase inspiration outdoors, in art, and in the everyday adventures of fatherhood.
